I enjoyed TF2, but TFC is the ultimate brother here. TFC follows the same rules as before, 9 classes, two teams, hundreds of maps, and a lot of killing. TF2 I never liked due to the serious unbalancing of the game, and yes TFC is a tad unbalanced too, but TF2 took it too far. That being said, It's nice to play TFC because I feel as if newcomers have a slighter chance of getting kills, BUT, if you are a newcomer, YOU WILL BE CRUSHED because this game is a tad dead meaning many experienced players do play this. As far as I know, there are about only 5 dedicated servers left for REAL players only, no bots. Drippy's 2fort is one of them that always seem populated, but I hope you don't mind playing 2fort for awhile since that seems to be the only popular real server left.

The graphics are from Half Life 1, sooo you should get an idea of what it looks like. As for sound, nothing really, just explosions, guns being shot off, turrents, doors opening, grunts from jumping, ETC.

The gameplay in this does require a bit more skill so mastering it is really hard. Snipers will pick you off instantly, Soldiers will destroy you, ETC. Haha, the gameplay is quite fun though, but remember, each class isn't for everybody, so you may need to experiment some if you wanna figure out what's best for you. My favorite is the Scout and Engineer. My only complaint in this game...are the grenades. As much as I love TFC, the grenades are absolutely overpowered and spammed to hell. The thing about grenades are that their blast radius is HUGE and people spam them everywhere. In 2fort, I have been killed too much by opening a door and having a grenade thrown at me and having me killed. Grenade spamfest is almost the name of the game, but once you get used to it, this game is downright fun and awesome.

Sure, this game is sadly dying, but there are still some servers left for real players, there is a server that hosts Dustbowl 24/7 for real players too and it's the second most popular server so if you get bored of 2fort from Drippy's, there is always that server. So help us TFC lovers bring this classic back to life by buying it. It's only $5.00, and it will offer you hours of fun on end. Many sleepless night I've had on TFC, trust me. I have almost 50 hours in this game and I know that I will still keep playing more in the future. So buy TFC today! You have nothing to lose other than your social life.

I actually didn't mind this game. Compared to the newer TF2 it really isn't great. The graphics are poor (for these days) and the gameplay modes and maps are limited. However the gameplay is actually quite good. Each class posseses unique and useful perks. Also it is suprisingly easy to find a match. I got this in a pack with HL1 and two dlcs for £8.99. The only real difference beetween these games and new ones is the graphics (not suprising seen as they came out over ten years ago). But if you're prepared to live with that you will really enjoy Team Fortress Classic.
This game is great if you are looking for a more challenging tf2

It might have been good back in 1999, but it really hasn't aged as well as it's brother, Counter Strike 1.6, has. I probably wouldn't buy it again, but that might just be because I'm so used to tf2.

Team Fortress is a very interesting time capsule and is exactly what it was designed to be back in the day, a class based Gold Source class and objective based shooter. That sounds obvious looking at it, but I recommend this game in mind that it plays more like a Half Life Deathmatch than TF2, and if you go into this game expecting anything similar to TF2 you'll be disappointed.

Servers will likely be populated with veterans if you play so I recommend port forwarding and setting up bots if you want a taste of what the game plays like without much struggle.

(Edited from a previously negative review)

Back in my day (Flashback) TFC was one of the most entertaining games (together with Half-Life) i earlier ever played. I already played it in my childhood and it can NOT be forgotten, how amazing it was. Good ol' times! You can pretty much compare it with the Free-to-play TF2.

Sadly it has lost it's population, which was earlier never empty.

Well. This game is old, and it kinda shows. I wasn't around in the time it was released, but TFC was probably great back then, just like Half-Life deathmatch was. But was is the key word here, it really hasn't aged well. On modern computers it's unstable and glitchy. I found myself invincible at times, constantly at 1 HP at others, walking backwards through walls. The community with it isn't great either. They're all just judgemental, calling new or unexperienced players "faggots". Hating on the superior (but faithful) sequel, TF2, for it's expansive cosmetic item service and it's popularity. I understand that back in the day many people loved this, but it can't keep up with, well, TF2. I don't reccomend this to anyone other than the purpose of nostalgia. And yeah, that's a fine reason to like or buy a game, I rebought Sonic Adventure, twice. But I don't think that one's aged well either.

While TF2 is a great game, thoguh I find that TFC can be just as fun, as long as you dont mind there not being any hats and having only stock weapons. But for an FPS it does somewhat stand against the test of time, though i feel it may very well fade away in the future. For now, i have to say that this game is great buy, especially if you get it in the Half-Life 1 Anthology pack. So if i were to give this game a rating (this goes for the pack also) I would give it my 7/10, well maybe 8/10.
